org.knime.core.data.sort

Class AbstractColumnTableSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.data.sort.AbstractColumnTableSorter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColumnBufferedDataTableSorter, ColumnDataTableSorter

    abstract class AbstractColumnTableSorter
extends Object
    Sorts a data table, in a fine configurable way. It uses the disk based k-way merge sort like e.g. the BufferedDataTableSorter, but with the additional functionality to sort only parts of the data table.
    Since:
    2.10
    Author:
    Marcel Hanser

      AbstractColumnTableSorter(DataTableSpec spec, long rowsCount)

      AbstractColumnTableSorter(DataTableSpec spec, long rowsCount, SortingDescription... descriptions)
      Sorts the columns of the given table as described in the provided SortingDescriptions.
      AbstractColumnTableSorter(DataTableSpec spec, long rowsCount, String... columnToSort)
      Sorts the columns of the given table separately and ascending.

    • Field Detail

      • DEF_MEM_THRESHOLD

        public static final double DEF_MEM_THRESHOLD
        Default memory threshold. If this relative amount of memory is filled, the chunk is sorted and flushed to disk.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractColumnTableSorter

        AbstractColumnTableSorter(DataTableSpec spec,
                          long rowsCount)
                   throws InvalidSettingsException
        The constructor is identical to AbstractColumnTableSorter(DataTableSpec, long, String...) with DataTableSpec.getColumnNames() as the last input.
        Parameters:
        spec - the spec
        rowsCount - the amount of rows of the data table, if known -1 otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - if arguments are inconsistent.
        NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

      • AbstractColumnTableSorter

        AbstractColumnTableSorter(DataTableSpec spec,
                          long rowsCount,
                          String... columnToSort)
                   throws InvalidSettingsException
        Sorts the columns of the given table separately and ascending. Attention this means that the data rows are split.
        Parameters:
        spec - the spec
        rowsCount - the amount of rows of the data table, if known -1 otherwise
        columnToSort - the columns to be sorted
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - if arguments are inconsistent.
        NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

      • AbstractColumnTableSorter

        AbstractColumnTableSorter(DataTableSpec spec,
                          long rowsCount,
                          SortingDescription... descriptions)
                   throws InvalidSettingsException
        Sorts the columns of the given table as described in the provided SortingDescriptions.
        Parameters:
        spec - the spec
        rowsCount - The number of rows in the table, if known -1 otherwise
        descriptions - the defined descriptions
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - If arguments are inconsistent.

      • setMaxOpenContainers

        public void setMaxOpenContainers(int value)
        Changes the number of maximum open containers (=files) during the sorting. Containers are used in the k-way merge sort, the higher the number the fewer iterations in the final merge need to be done.

        The default is 500.

        Parameters:
        value - the maxOpenContainers to number of maximal open containers.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If argument is smaller or equal to 2.

      • setMemActionIndicator

        void setMemActionIndicator(MemoryAlertSystem.MemoryActionIndicator memIndicator)
        Package visible due test issues.
        Parameters:
        memIndicator - the memService to set
